title: Looking for Stone Informal alternative for yoga book
content:
Hi All,

We're doing an illustrated book of yoga exercises which will have more photos than type. A previous book in the genre used Stone Informal but they want to replace that with something else that's different but the same, the usual story.

So I think I'm looking for something that might be somewhere between a serif and a sans or perhaps a particularly lively sans font that's not one of the usual suspects.

Any thoughts/directions/suggestions gratefully accepted.

John
author: dot dot dot

comments.content: [Sumner Stone](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230528/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/stonetypefoundry.html) has numerous typefaces that might work.

<cite> > particularly lively sans font that’s not one of the usual suspects.</cite>

Nothing like Stone Informal, but you might consider [Beorcana](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230528/http:/www.beorcana.com/welcome.html). I think it would work well with the subject.

What do you think about Dancer Serif (shares some of the "schoolbook attributes")?  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontpartners/fp\_dancer\_serif\_pac...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230528/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontpartners/fp_dancer_serif_package/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontpartners/fp\_dancer\_serif\_package/")  
Check also Dancer Sans.
